poem:
"Merger in the Morning"

Green as fresh-dug dollars,
Nation and Virgin waltz.
Concrete towers rustle,
whispers of £2.9bn set to fly.
Mortgage mountains shift,
Duffy's departure noted in passing.
Fear gnaws the morning - a review -
Scattered leaves hinting job losses,
an unknown harvest to reap.
Modern rituals, financial fandangos,
economic looms weave through
the tired tapestry of dawn.
